channel.title: Transferring...?
channel.description:
So I Have a few accounts that have about 200k on them each and how would I go about transferring the money to my another account? I've never done bounty hunter and I don't think I want to, but if it's the only way for a couple of f2p accounts then it's the only way.
Thanks in advance :D

item.title: Transferring...?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

It’ll probably be bounty hunter. But if I lose the first lot it’ll be something to learn off. Thanks guys; if you come up with any more please do tell me.

Read full topic

item.title: Transferring...?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Squigglyo:

why 49k each time?

Nearly every banker yells the amount of the drop if it’s 50k+ to avoid rwt

Read full topic

item.title: Transferring...?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Drop party room, 49k each time. I did it with like 4 mills (took a while though).

item.title: Transferring...?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

BH is best, I transfer all cash over it.

Read full topic

item.title: Transferring...?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:7, topic:254495”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=336293.msg2619691#msg2619691 date=1231286598]

Trading money via the grand exchange doesn’t work at all. The other day, a friend of mine was buying 100 rune crossbows for max and I sold one of mine for lowest. Guess what happened? It took nearly 5 hours to sell and I’d bet he wasn’t the one who got it.

This is why people use d stone method or bh
[/quote]What’s the “d stone” method?

Player a is selling gold to player b. Player a buys as many dragon stones as possible, player b buys tonnes of chaos runes and sells for tokkul(SP?) player a then sells the d stones to the shop and player b buys them with tokkul, this transferring the money from a > b with a tiny amount of loss. But player B needs to have money to start off with to buy it.[/quote]

Yeah… that’s an easy one to disprove. If you transfer 1,000,000 gold with that method, player b only ends up with like 1,200,000. And if you don’t believe this, look over your method. It is a basic way of merchanting that blows through a large sum of money with little profit. Not worth the time whatsoever.

The most effective way of money transfer is Bounty Hunter, tbh.

Read full topic

item.title: Transferring...?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:6, topic:254495”][quote author=pk4pk link=topic=336293.msg2619642#msg2619642 date=1231285076]

Trading money via the grand exchange doesn’t work at all. The other day, a friend of mine was buying 100 rune crossbows for max and I sold one of mine for lowest. Guess what happened? It took nearly 5 hours to sell and I’d bet he wasn’t the one who got it.

This is why people use d stone method or bh
[/quote]What’s the “d stone” method?[/quote]

Player a is selling gold to player b. Player a buys as many dragon stones as possible, player b buys tonnes of chaos runes and sells for tokkul(SP?) player a then sells the d stones to the shop and player b buys them with tokkul, this transferring the money from a > b with a tiny amount of loss. But player B needs to have money to start off with to buy it.
